Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
CAN: The student can draw and label basic animals like fish or birds and place them in recognizable habitats such as water or trees.
The student can indicate basic needs of animals (e.g., food or water) by drawing simple items like a fish near water or a bird with a worm.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to accurately depict more complex habitats or interactions (e.g., placing a desert animal in a rainforest background).
The student may misunderstand the needs of an animal (e.g., drawing a fish needing sunlight instead of water) or incorrectly label habitat features without linkage to the animal's survival needs.
